required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multivalent HPV (Human Papillomavirus) Vaccine Study in 16- to 26-Year Old Men and Women (V503-003)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Clinical Trial to Study the Tolerability and Immunogenicity of V503, a Multivalent Human Papillomavirus (HPV) L1 Virus-Like Particle (VLP) Vaccine, in 16- to 26-Year-Old Men and 16- to 26-Year-Old Women

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the immunogenicity and tolerability of V503 in 16- to 26-year old men and women. The overall goal is to bridge V503 efficacy findings in young women to young men based on the demonstration of similar immunogenicity and safety profiles.

detailed_description.textblock: Study participants will be administered a 3-dose regimen of V503. They will be assessed for immunogenicity 1 month following completion of vaccination. All participants will be followed for safety for a total of 12 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric mean titers (GMTs) to the HPV types contained in the V503 vaccine
Number of participants with injection-site adverse experiences of erythema, pain, and swelling
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through Day 5 following any vaccination

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with elevated body temperature (≥100° F)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through Day 5 following any vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with seroconversion to the HPV types in the V503 vaccine

arm_group.arm_group_label: Heterosexual men 16 to 26 years of age
Men 16 to 26 years of age who have sex with men

intervention.description: Multivalent HPV L1 VLP vaccine, 0.5 mL intramuscular injection at Day 1, Month 2, and Month 6
intervention.arm_group_label: Heterosexual men 16 to 26 years of age
Men 16 to 26 years of age who have sex with men

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Good physical health
- Has never had Pap testing (cervical or anal) or has only had normal Pap test results
- Other inclusion criteria will be discussed with the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of severe allergic reaction that required medical intervention
- Currently enrolled in a clinical trial
- If participant is female, pregnant
- Currently immunocompromised or having received immunosuppressive therapy in the last year
- Positive test for HPV
- History of HPV-related external genital lesions or HPV-related anal lesions or anal cancer
- If participant is female, history of abnormal cervical biopsy results
- Other exclusion criteria will be discussed with the investigator
